revised_title: Temperature Dependence of Heats of Mixing in Liquid Mixtures
tldr: The authors developed a calorimeter to measure the heat of mixing in liquid mixtures over a wide temperature range. They studied the equimolar mixtures of benzene-toluene, toluene-para-xylene, and benzene-para-xylene, finding that the heat of mixing is less than 0.2 kJ/mol. The results provide insights into the temperature dependence of heats of mixing in liquid mixtures.
